bioseq package¶

Submodules¶

bioseq module¶

class bioseq.bioseq.BioSeq(sequence, seq_type)[source]¶

Bases: object

General purpose class for handling and manipulating biological sequences and perform operations on them.

_assert_seq_type()[source]¶

Assert a proper valid has been chosen for seq_type

_assert_valid_sequence()[source]¶

assert that all the tokens in the sequence are valid for that sequence type

frequency()[source]¶

Calculates the relative frequency of each token in the sequence

gc_content()[source]¶

Calculate the gc_content of the sequence

load(filename)[source]¶

Load object from file

pretty_print()[source]¶

Outputs a prettified and informative string onto the console, describing the current sequence

reverse = {}¶

rules for reverse_complement

reverse_complement()[source]¶

Given a Biological sequence, generate the reverse complement sequence for the specific type. Uses the static variable reverse

save(filename)[source]¶

Save an object to a file

seq_type = None¶

DNA, RNA, PROTEIN

sequence = None¶

The current sequence

valid_tokens = {}¶

Which tokens a given biological sequence can have

valid_types = {'DNA', 'PROTEIN', 'RNA'}¶

What are the valid values for seq_type

dnaseq module¶

class bioseq.dnaseq.DNASeq(sequence)[source]¶

Bases: bioseq.bioseq.BioSeq

Biological Sequence specific for DNA

codon_usage(aminoacid)[source]¶

Given a sequence, transcript it to RNA and call the respective codon_usage to get the frequency of each codon in it that maps to a specific aminoacid. Returns a dict.

open_reading_frames()[source]¶

Given a sequence, get all the possible open reading frames for each reading frame after transcripting to RNASeq

reverse = {'A': 'T', 'C': 'G', 'G': 'C', 'T': 'A'}¶
transcription()[source]¶

Performs a transcription of the original sequence from DNA to RNA and returns a RNASeq object

translation(start=0)[source]¶

Given a DNA sequence, transcript it to RNA and call the respective translation method for RNA sequences. Starts codon split at position start (default is 0). Returns a ProteinSeq instance.

valid_tokens = {'A', 'C', 'G', 'T'}¶

rnaseq module¶

class bioseq.rnaseq.RNASeq(sequence)[source]¶

Bases: bioseq.bioseq.BioSeq

Biological Sequence specific for RNA

_reading_frames()[source]¶

Given a sequence, get all the possible aminoacid sequences (always 6)

codon_usage(aminoacid)[source]¶

Given a sequence, calculate the frequency of each codon in it that maps to a specific aminoacid. Returns a dict.

dict_of_aminoacids = {'AAA': 'K', 'AAC': 'N', 'AAG': 'K', 'AAU': 'N', 'ACA': 'T', 'ACC': 'T', 'ACG': 'T', 'ACU': 'T', 'AGA': 'R', 'AGC': 'S', 'AGG': 'R', 'AGU': 'S', 'AUA': 'I', 'AUC': 'I', 'AUG': 'M', 'AUU': 'I', 'CAA': 'Q', 'CAC': 'H', 'CAG': 'Q', 'CAU': 'H', 'CCA': 'P', 'CCC': 'P', 'CCG': 'P', 'CCU': 'P', 'CGA': 'R', 'CGC': 'R', 'CGG': 'R', 'CGU': 'R', 'CUA': 'L', 'CUC': 'L', 'CUG': 'L', 'CUU': 'L', 'GAA': 'E', 'GAC': 'D', 'GAG': 'E', 'GAU': 'D', 'GCA': 'A', 'GCC': 'A', 'GCG': 'A', 'GCU': 'A', 'GGA': 'G', 'GGC': 'G', 'GGG': 'G', 'GGU': 'G', 'GUA': 'V', 'GUC': 'V', 'GUG': 'V', 'GUU': 'V', 'UAA': '_', 'UAC': 'Y', 'UAG': '_', 'UAU': 'Y', 'UCA': 'S', 'UCC': 'S', 'UCG': 'S', 'UCU': 'S', 'UGA': '_', 'UGC': 'C', 'UGG': 'W', 'UGU': 'C', 'UUA': 'L', 'UUC': 'F', 'UUG': 'L', 'UUU': 'F'}¶
open_reading_frames()[source]¶

Given a sequence, get all the possible open reading frames for each reading frame

reverse = {'A': 'U', 'C': 'G', 'G': 'C', 'U': 'A'}¶
translation(start=0)[source]¶

Given an RNA sequence, translate its 3-token codons into the respective aminoacids. Starts codon split at position start (default is 0). Returns a ProteinSeq instance.

valid_tokens = {'A', 'C', 'G', 'U'}¶

utils module¶

bioseq.utils.get_dict_of_dna_to_aminoacids()[source]¶

Get a dictionary that maps RNA codons onto their respective proteins

bioseq.utils.read_fasta(filename)[source]¶

Function that reads a FASTA file into a list of its ProteinSeq entries. Returns list of tuples (comment, ProteinSeq)
